abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's backing away from promise to halt growth of Uber has created rift in his relationship with City Council Speaker Melissa Mark-Viverito, who criticized de Blasio in news conference over his compromise with company; criticism lays bare fact that many city politicians feel as if de Blasio is taking their support for granted.
lead_paragraph: After Mayor Bill de Blasio backed away from his vow to halt the growth of the car-hailing service Uber, Melissa Mark-Viverito, the City Council speaker, delivered a searing rebuke to the mayor.

headline.main: Uber Deal Strains Ties for de Blasio and Mark-Viverito
headline.print_headline: Deal on Uber Strains Ties for de Blasio and Close Ally

snippet: After Mayor Bill de Blasio backed away from his vow to halt the growth of the car-hailing service Uber, Melissa Mark-Viverito, the City Council speaker, delivered a searing rebuke to the mayor.
